channel.title: Link on marcus
channel.description: Recent content in Link on marcus
channel.copyright: Code released under the MIT license.

item.title: Fosdem 2025 Conference Report
item.description: Attended Fosdem again this year and had a blast. Made a conference report for work, so figure I might as well post it here too. :)

item.title: Are WAFs worth it?
item.description: Interesting article which discourages the use of web application firewalls. I feel they have some pretty solid arguments.

item.title: Changesets now!
item.description: We have indeed worked around some or these problems, by automatically dismissing stale reviews, mostly having single commit PRs and so on, but I strongly agree this model would just be better.

item.title: Making your own binary format
item.description:
I learned a lot from this article detailing how to make your own .com executable format for Linux. Also loved this little nugget:

All these others are just sitting around, neglected. We should start using them more. I mean, why not? Heck, put emojis in your filenames. I’m not your dad. Alan, if you’re reading this: I forbid you to put emojis in your filenames

item.title: nixOS for the impatient
item.description: Nice pragmatic intro to my favorite Linux distribution.

item.title: Parsing QR codes by hand
item.description: Excellent deep dive on how QR codes work. Kinda tempted to get a QR code tattoo. Question is, what should it say. 🙈

item.title: Type clipboard with Alfred
item.description: Ever in a situation where clipboard isn’t operational, say inside two layers of vdi for instance? This Alfred workflow can help!

item.title: Prometheus on Nixos
item.description: Great guide to setting up monitoring on your nixos install

item.title: Pair programming
item.description: To me this has always seemed intuitively right. Unfortunate that so many developers seem hesitant to participate in pair programming.

item.title: Free Cnc project files.
item.description: Some nice cnc projects, should give these a try.

item.title: JellyFin - Plex replacement?
item.description: “JellyFin is the volunteer-built media solution that puts you in control of your media. Stream to any device from your own server, with no strings attached. Your media, your server, your way.”
